Just got back from camping in the new forset at a site called " SANDY BALLS"

A very good campsite which was very friendly to both children and pets.

There was a indoor and out door swimming pool ( outdoor not yet open) a gym Several play areas, including slides and swings an activity field to play football and fly kites etc...

The toilet blocks even had underfloor heating, it was wamer in the toilet than my van

It not far from the Avon river and i even think the campsite has right to fish it..

There was a cycle centre on site to hire your bike and child buggies etc..

A PUB with Sky

a Spar shop

A indoor play area for kids with a ball Pen

Overall it was a very good site and well worth visting if you are after a site with a few extras, there is a website somewhere just type sandy balls you can't go to far wrong..

Thanks ste

Cheers FamilyVan,

We were just talking about the New Forest last night.
We didn't have much time to find a campsite there last year and ended up in an awful site just inside the boundary near Ashurst. Trains, main road, planes, dirty toilets, flippin 'eck! Mind you - it was JUST in the Forest and no more and most people there used it as a stop off point from Southampton!

That one sounds MUCH better. Good call.

I can Highly recommend Sandy Balls. Stayed there about six weeks ago.

It was the first stop on our family tour of Dorset, Devon and Cornwall. Took about four weeks in all. Over 1000 miles!.
I'ts a big commercial site so you get all of the facilities that come with it, great for kids, however dont go if you want a break from the kids or a bit of peace and quiet.
Also if your bus is lowered watch out for the killer speed humps. By-standers will point and cringe as your steering box grinds across the top!

Phelpo,

could you recommend any places you stayed as I am looking to do the same type of tour in August/September.

steve.

Hi Steve,

Just tried to reply to your private message, spent ages describing the sites that we stayed at and then went to send it and the damn thing vanished...Doh!!

Here's a much shorter version..

We travelled from the new forrest around the coast of Dorset, Devon and Cornwall and then back to Gloucester over the course of three and a half weeks.
To be honest, we found most of the sites to be pretty much average, most have redeeming features, but are poor in other ways.
The exceptions to this were the following sites that we liked a lot and were the only ones that we would recommend or want to stay at again....

1. Trethem mill www.trethem.com

This site is located in Truro, Cornwall. This was our favourite site by miles, its quite small so dosent have a bar etc. but the owners are very friendly, great for kids (games room, football pitch, play area) excellent toilets and showers, Terraced pitches with view of valley.

2. Oakdown - Sidmouth. www.oakdown.co.uk

The website dose'nt do this place justice, its really lovely. Excellent facilities, Donkey sanctury, small golf course, nature walks, laundry, games room etc. Just avoid the pitches that back on to the road as it can be a bit noisy.

3. Dornafield - Newton Abbot. www.dornafield.com

Slightly larger site and has without a doubt the best toilets/showers anywhere we have stayed. Very helpfull and friendly staff (they let us drive around and choose our pitch) Childrens play area, shop etc. The best pitches are at the top by the childrens area, try and get one of these if you can.

To sum up, So many factors can influence your stay at any site, but my best advice to you would go for sites that are recommended by the caravan club, I know they are a bunch of stuffy old gits with 30 grand 4x4's pulling equally expensive white boxes, but they dont stay at places with skids in the pan, no bog roll or pubes on the soap...... unless you like that kind of place?!!
We stayed there too, about 4 weeks ago. The best site I have ever been to!

That's my local site. Quite often I take the kids for an over nighter. Very well run and environmentally sound. Great woodland & river walks too.
Highly recommended.
just had a week in one of there caravans fantastic
